channel.title: Abilities that are unusable before D3
channel.description:
Personally, I dislike the concept of locking an ability until a certain time period. I think it's a very clunky solution to balance and gamethrowing problems. I also think evils should be able to target themselves and their allies with all of their abilities.
In some niche cases, a killer can predict he will be swapped with his target and himself. At the moment you're only counter is to do nothing (if you're Assassin or Cult Leader) or attack anyway and just hope you're not swapped (if you're NK).
This is especially annoying if you're trying to convert someone and know you will be swapped with yourself. Of course it's a niche case, but still.
Regarding the main topic, which is abilities like Prince exe, Knight CS, and Smite not being usable until N3. It's very annoying to jail someone acting like a Fool N1, because now you've got a confirmed evil in prison but you have no way to kill him safely for 2 more days.
Knight CS. If three people claim alchemist D1, why shouldn't he be able to coldsteel the most suspicious of them? Just because it's D1 doesn't mean you can't make a judgment on which is the most suspicious. And it's **very** often you find an evil D2 who might be a Fool but the Knight still can't kill him for another day.
Paladin Smite. I admit that locking Smite until N3 was a **VERY** good move balance-wise. However I still feel uncomfortable with it and feel there are better solutions. Such as letting Smite be used any night but not usable again if you miss with it.

item.title: Abilities that are unusable before D3
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
RHCube:

That would be throwing though, as by saying “protect me” you’re encouraging BD to protect you. And that can already happen with CoD. Hunter is unique as well

Never met any Retribution hunters? It will be abused.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
That would be rare though. Usually only a few people visit a player during the first few nights. It would be like circle of death.

Firelitten1:

“I’m prince protect me”

7 people have died all bd

That would be throwing though, as by saying “protect me” you’re encouraging BD to protect you. And that can already happen with CoD. Hunter is unique as well

item.source: Abilities that are unusable before D3

item.title: Abilities that are unusable before D3
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Shrimpy:

Yolo smites are unlikely to work, if by yolo you mean random.

They’re unlikely, but still annoying when they do work.

Shrimpy:

I think it used to be like that, but was changed probably because all Paladins only ever used it on themselves. And it wasn’t fun to smite someone only to get converted yourself.

There’s nothing wrong with paladins using it only on themselves. They risk a more important BD member being converted.

Shrimpy:

And it wasn’t fun to smite someone only to get converted yourself.

That added to the risk in using it. Right now there is no risk at all. At least with defend and bear possessor can trick them.

Shrimpy:

I think it would be worth considering forcing the Paladin to correctly identify the Cult Leader in order to kill him with Smite.

Yeah, that’s why I think it’s overpowered. They can kill the CL without even knowing who they are. It can’t even affect BD.

Shrimpy:

I would rather Maid Spy be reverted but usable on King.

Agreed, the new maid spy discourages whispering too much. And the old maid spy wasn’t really that bad, it just needed to work like sheriff’s scout(meaning it remains until you change targets)

Read full topic
item.source: Abilities that are unusable before D3

item.title: Abilities that are unusable before D3
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Smite would be even worse without the lock.

I agree. I don’t like the lock but I think it should stay unless a better solution is found.

Paladin is already a boring class.

I think Paladin is fun because of Smite.

What about yolo smites?

Yolo smites are unlikely to work, if by yolo you mean random.

At the very least it shouldn’t affect both the paladin and their target.

I think it used to be like that, but was changed probably because all Paladins only ever used it on themselves. And it wasn’t fun to smite someone only to get converted yourself.

It can kill the CL without you even knowing who the CL is. You shouldn’t be able to kill scum like that.

I think it would be worth considering forcing the Paladin to correctly identify the Cult Leader in order to kill him with Smite. But I do think Smite is very low on the list of abilities that need changing. I would rather Maid Spy be reverted but usable on King.

Read full topic
item.source: Abilities that are unusable before D3

item.title: Abilities that are unusable before D3
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
And here’s another issue: It’s a bit redundant since we already have physician for dealing with attackers. Heal is better than defend overall. Sure, defend can kill attackers, but it only works twice, only affects visitors, and doesn’t protect against poison/bleed. We should only have one main class for protecting against attackers.

Read full topic

item.title: Abilities that are unusable before D3
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
They do need a bit of a rework, but they can be tricked by possessor. There’s no way to trick smite. All abilities should have a way to trick them and/or have risk involved. Bear should just be changed so it’s one use but kills all visitors. I’m not sure what to do with defend though.

Read full topic
